intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidodendron undulatum, commonly known as the wavy-leaf elaeodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wavy-edged leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
